issue.description: Use phrases for attributes and indicate which are optional

description.p: Observation_item identifies an item by its string-type identifier. The same id-string may be used in different context to identify different instances; an Observation_item may not identify an instance unambiguously.

Allow, at least in addition, the identification of an instance directly, by a pointer. If this is not possible, Observation_item should get an additional attribute "identifier_role" that when being populated shall correspond to a Identification_assignment.role .
The module introduction and scope refer to examples that can be handled using explicit capabilities provided by other modules.

Remove specific examples and add text (in the introduction) stating that observation is provided as a fall-back when other more specific mechanisms - such as State_observed cannot be used. Change examples accordingly.
Add similar text/recommendation to Annex H of ISO 10303-239.
Text added to Annex H of ISO 10303-239.
Introduction to module re-written. Example replaced.

With respect to the ballot comment: The comment is true. However there is no way to avoid the possibility of ambiguity without adopting approaches specific to each different implementation aproach. Have therefore clarified the position in the note on Observation_item.

issue.description:
Problem Description: The use of observation always requires the use of the escape mechanism to reference items, whereas, in some cases an AP may wish to restrict the usage to particular entities.
Suggest: The entity Observation_item should be subtyped (oneof) to Observation_item_selected and Observation_item_reference Observation_item would become an abstract type, and the current attributes migrated to Onservation_item_reference Observation_item_selected would have a single attribute pointing to an extensible select.
Additional Notes: An AP could chose to define the set of things an observation is restricted to by a rule allowing only the Observation_item_select subtype and extending the associated select.
